name: The Silent Patient
title: A shocking psychological thriller of a woman's act of violence against her husband.

name: Where the Crawdads Sing
title: A story of survival, mystery, and love set in the marshes of North Carolina.

name: Educated
title: A memoir by Tara Westover about growing up in a strict and abusive household in rural Idaho.

name: Becoming
title: Michelle Obama's memoir recounts her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House.

name: Normal People
title: The story of a complex relationship between two people who can't seem to let each other go.

name: The Great Gatsby
title: A classic novel that explores themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

name: Little Fires Everywhere
title: A drama that explores the complexities of family life in suburban America.

name: Dune
title: A science fiction epic set in a distant future amidst a huge interstellar empire.
George Orwell's dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance to control citizens.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
title: A novel about teenage rebellion and angst in 1950s America.

name: The Road
title: A post-apocalyptic tale of a father and son's journey through a desolate landscape.

name: The Book Thief
title: The story of a young girl living in Nazi Germany, narrated by Death.

name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
title: The first book in the beloved Harry Potter series, introducing the world of Hogwarts.

name: The Hunger Games
title: A dystopian novel where a young girl must survive a televised death match.

name: The Alchemist
title: A philosophical novel about a shepherd's journey to discover his personal legend.

name: Pride and Prejudice
title: Jane Austen's classic novel about the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British gentry.

name: The Hobbit
title: J.R.R. Tolkien's fantasy novel about Bilbo Baggins' adventure in Middle-earth.

name: The Da Vinci Code
title: A mystery thriller that follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he uncovers secrets of the Catholic Church.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
title: Harper Lee's novel about racial injustice in the Deep South during the 1930s.

name: The Shining
title: Stephen King's horror novel about a haunted hotel and the family's descent into madness.

name: The Handmaid's Tale
title: A dystopian novel set in a future where women are stripped of their rights.

name: The Girl on the Train
title: A psychological thriller about a woman who believes she witnessed a crime from her train window.

name: Fahrenheit 451
title: Ray Bradbury's classic novel about a future society where books are banned.

name: Gone Girl
title: A psychological thriller that explores the complexities of marriage and deceit.

name: Brave New World
title: A dystopian novel that imagines a future society obsessed with consumerism and control.

name: The Goldfinch
title: A novel about a boy whose life is upended by the death of his mother in a museum explosion.

name: The Outsiders
title: A classic novel that tells the story of teenage rebellion and class conflict in the 1960s.

name: The Bell Jar
title: Sylvia Plath's semi-autobiographical novel about a young woman's mental breakdown.

name: Moby-Dick
title: Herman Melville's epic tale of obsession and revenge on the high seas.

name: The Road
title: A post-apocalyptic novel about a father and son's journey through a devastated America.

name: The Odyssey
title: Homer's epic poem recounting the adventures of Odysseus as he returns home from the Trojan War.

name: The Catch-22
title: Joseph Heller's satirical novel about the absurdities of war and bureaucracy.

name: The Godfather
title: Mario Puzo's novel about the Corleone crime family and the world of organized crime.

name: The Chronicles of Narnia
title: C.S. Lewis's classic fantasy series about the magical land of Narnia.

name: War and Peace
title: Leo Tolstoy's epic novel about the lives of Russian aristocrats during the Napoleonic Wars.

name: The Color Purple
title: Alice Walker's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel about the life of African American women in the South.

name: The Lord of the Rings
title: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy trilogy about the battle between good and evil in Middle-earth.

name: The Kite Runner
title: Khaled Hosseini's novel about friendship, betrayal, and redemption in Afghanistan.

name: The Secret History
title: Donna Tartt's novel about a group of elite college students who become involved in a murder.

name: The Time Traveler's Wife
title: A love story about a man with a genetic disorder that causes him to time travel unpredictably.

name: Life of Pi
title: Yann Martel's novel about a boy stranded on a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger.

name: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
title: A mystery thriller about a journalist and a hacker investigating a wealthy family's secrets.

name: Slaughterhouse-Five
title: Kurt Vonnegut's satirical novel about the bombing of Dresden and the absurdity of war.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
title: J.D. Salinger's novel about teenage rebellion and alienation in 1950s America.

name: Dracula
title: Bram Stoker's gothic horror novel about the vampire Count Dracula.

name: Frankenstein
title: Mary Shelley's novel about a scientist who creates a living being from dead tissue.

name: The Strange Case of Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde
title: Robert Louis Stevenson's novella about a man with two personalities, one good and one evil.

name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
title: Oscar Wilde's novel about a man who remains young while his portrait ages.

name: Wuthering Heights
title: Emily Brontë's novel about the passionate and destructive love between Catherine and Heathcliff.

name: The Grapes of Wrath
title: John Steinbeck's novel about a poor family traveling to California during the Great Depression.

name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
title: Gabriel García Márquez's novel about the rise and fall of the Buendía family.

name: The Sun Also Rises
title: Ernest Hemingway's novel about a group of expatriates living in Paris and Spain after World War I.

name: Lolita

name: Madame Bovary
title: Gustave Flaubert's novel about a woman who seeks romance and excitement outside her marriage.

name: Murder on the Orient Express
title: Agatha Christie's mystery novel about a murder on a luxury train.

name: The Old Man and the Sea
title: Ernest Hemingway's novella about an old fisherman's struggle to catch a giant marlin.

name: The Trial
title: Franz Kafka's novel about a man who is arrested and prosecuted by an inaccessible authority.

name: The Metamorphosis
title: Franz Kafka's novella about a man who wakes up one day to find himself transformed into a giant insect.

name: Crime and Punishment
title: Fyodor Dostoevsky's novel about a man who commits a crime and struggles with guilt and redemption.

name: The Brothers Karamazov
title: Fyodor Dostoevsky's novel about the lives of three brothers and the murder of their father.

name: War and Peace
title: Leo Tolstoy's novel about the lives of aristocratic families during the Napoleonic Wars.

name: The Art of War
title: Sun Tzu's ancient Chinese military treatise on strategy, tactics, and warfare.

name: The Prince
title: Niccolò Machiavelli's political treatise on power, leadership, and statecraft.

name: The Republic
title: Plato's philosophical dialogue on justice, the ideal state, and the nature of the human soul.
